Hard Sigmoid¶

class layers.activation.HardSigmoid.HardSigmoid[source]¶

Implements the Hard Sigmoid activation layer.

The Hard Sigmoid is a computationally cheaper, piecewise linear approximation of the standard Sigmoid function. Its formula is f(x) = max(0, min(1, x / 6 + 0.5)).

It is faster to compute than Sigmoid and can be useful in specific architectures, especially in resource-constrained environments.

input¶

Stores the input from the forward pass, which is needed to calculate the gradient in the backward pass.

Type:

np.ndarray

backward(grad_output)[source]¶

Performs the backward pass of the layer.

The derivative of Hard Sigmoid is a constant (1/6) in the linear region between -3 and 3, and 0 otherwise.

Parameters:

grad_output (np.ndarray) – The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s output.

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The gradient of the loss with respect to this layer’s input.

  • None, since Hard Sigmoid has no trainable parameters.

Return type:

tuple[np.ndarray, None]

forward(input_data)[source]¶

Performs the forward pass of the layer.

Parameters:

input_data (np.ndarray) – The input data from the previous layer.

Returns:

The output of the layer after applying the Hard Sigmoid function.

Return type:

np.ndarray
